definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Diffenbaugh and Ashfaq focus specifically on heat waves over the United States.
sentences.chinese: 迪芬巴夫和阿什法克的研究特別關注美國的熱浪。

sentences.english: This heat wave has everyone dragging around.
sentences.chinese: 這陣熱浪已使每個人感到倦怠。

sentences.english: This heat wave is keeping temperatures high all day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一整天都熱浪滾滾。

sentences.english: Beyond the illusionary screen, summer heat is billowing.
sentences.chinese: 幻覺的屏風之外，夏天，熱浪滾滾。

sentences.english: She soon wilted in the morning heat.
sentences.chinese: 在早晨的熱浪中，她很快就蔫兒了。

sentences.english: A 15-day heat wave raised temperatures up to 110 degrees Fahrenheit.
sentences.chinese: 一場持續了15天的熱浪使氣溫升高到110華氏度。

sentences.english: We may be able to make very very small power sources out of them.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該可以從這些熱浪中製作出十分小的電源。

sentences.english: Heat vapour steamed the desert under the blazing sun.
sentences.chinese: 在熾熱的太陽照耀下，沙漠騰起股股熱浪。

sentences.english: Russia has been scorched by heatwave and its forests incinerated.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯已經被熱浪烤焦，森森已經化爲灰燼。

sentences.english: The heat wave continues to bring hot temperatures to the Southland. Getty Images / Kevork Djansezian
sentences.chinese: 熱浪持續給美國南部地區帶來高溫。

sentences.english: Heatwaves, meanwhile, increase deaths from other heart-related causes.
sentences.chinese: 而熱浪則是心臟病導致死亡的原因之一。

sentences.english: The frequency of heatwaves is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 熱浪發生的頻率正在加快。

sentences.english: And then came summer, with heat-waves across much of the Northern Hemisphere.
sentences.chinese: 接着夏天到來，熱浪席捲了北半球的大部分地區。

sentences.english: The heat wave along with occasional power-cuts had made life miserable here.
sentences.chinese: 熱浪外加偶爾停電，使得這裏的生活相當痛苦。

sentences.english: The heatwave has been blamed on masses of hot air from the Sahara Desert moving north.
sentences.chinese: 這場熱浪歸罪於從撒哈拉沙漠向北襲來的大量熱空氣。

sentences.english: This summer, people flocked to the swimming pool to keep cool during the heat wave.
sentences.chinese: 今年夏天，人們成羣結隊來到泳池納涼，躲避熱浪。

definition: a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
to carry within it/to be mixed in/to slip sth in/to intersperse/(hydrology etc) to entrain/to smuggle/notes smuggled into an exam
